New Records: Tyler O'Neill hit the 30th home run of the season
Key Match Events: Tyler O'Neill hit a walk-off three-run home run in the bottom of the 10th inning
Nick Pivetta struck out 9 over six strong innings
Justin Slaten allowed a solo home run to Anthony Santander in the eighth that tied the game at 2-2
The Orioles took a 3-2 lead in the 10th on Rivera's RBI single to score the extra-innings ghost runner
Pre-Game Insights: The stakes for Boston loomed clear on the Green Monster scoreboard as the Detroit Tigers had already won and the Minnesota Twins held a late lead over the Los Angeles Angels
Post-Match Reflections: With the victory, the Red Sox remain four games out of a playoff spot with 16 games to play
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Red Sox already have enough ground to make up in the American League wild-card race, and time is not on the club's side
The game was a series finale and the Red Sox won 5-3 on a walk-off three-run home run by Tyler O'Neill
Others: The Red Sox starter Nick Pivetta was not so fortunate in the top of the third as he allowed a leadoff solo home run to Baltimore's No. 9 hitter, Emmanuel Rivera
